title: Choosing the Right AI Model
description: Learn how to select and configure the most appropriate AI model for different types of tasks.

steps.title: Introduction to AI Models
steps.description:
AI-First TextEditor supports multiple AI models with different capabilities, strengths, and resource requirements. Choosing the right model for your specific task can significantly improve results and efficiency.

In this tutorial, you'll learn about the different models available, their characteristics, and how to select the most appropriate one for various coding tasks.

steps.title: Understanding Model Types
steps.description:
AI-First TextEditor supports several types of models:

1. **Large Language Models (LLMs)**: General-purpose models like GPT-4, Claude, etc.
2. **Code-specialized Models**: Models fine-tuned specifically for code generation and understanding
3. **Local Models**: Smaller models that run directly on your machine
4. **Cloud Models**: More powerful models that run on remote servers

Each type has different strengths, limitations, and use cases.

steps.title: Accessing the Model Selection
steps.description:
To view and select available models:

1. Click on 'Settings' in the menu bar
2. Select 'AI Model Selection'
3. Browse the list of available models

The dialog shows model details including provider, capabilities, and context window size.

Try opening the Model Selection dialog now.

steps.title: Understanding Model Capabilities
steps.description:
Each model has different capabilities indicated in the model details:

- **Code Generation**: Ability to write code from descriptions
- **Code Understanding**: Ability to analyze and explain existing code
- **Refactoring**: Ability to improve code structure without changing functionality
- **Debugging**: Ability to identify and fix errors
- **Context Window**: How much text the model can consider at once

Hover over models in the selection dialog to see their capabilities.

steps.title: Local vs. Cloud Models
steps.description:
Consider these factors when choosing between local and cloud models:

**Local Models**:
- Run directly on your machine
- No network latency
- Greater privacy
- Limited capabilities
- Lower resource requirements

**Cloud Models**:
- Run on remote servers
- More powerful
- Require internet connection
- May have usage costs
- Better for complex tasks

Local models are marked with [Local] in the selection dialog.

steps.title: Selecting Models for Specific Tasks
steps.description:
Different tasks benefit from different models:

1. **Quick Code Snippets**: Smaller, faster models
2. **Complex System Design**: Larger models with bigger context windows
3. **Specialized Domains**: Models fine-tuned for specific languages/frameworks
4. **Code Explanation**: Models with strong reasoning capabilities
5. **Iterative Development**: Models that maintain context well

Consider the complexity and specificity of your task when selecting a model.

steps.title: Changing Models Mid-Project
steps.description:
You can change models during a project for different phases:

1. Open the Model Selection dialog
2. Select a new model
3. Click 'Apply'

AI-First TextEditor will maintain your project context when possible, but be aware that changing models may reset some conversation context.

Try changing to a different model now.

steps.title: Provider-Specific Features
steps.description:
Different AI providers offer unique features:

1. **OpenAI**: Strong code generation, various model sizes
2. **Anthropic**: Good at following complex instructions
3. **Local Providers**: Privacy-focused, no API costs

Some features in AI-First TextEditor may be optimized for specific providers.

Explore the different provider options in the Model Selection dialog.

steps.title: Conclusion
steps.description:
Congratulations! You've completed the AI Model Selection tutorial.

You've learned about:
- Different types of AI models
- Model capabilities and limitations
- Local vs. cloud models
- Selecting models for specific tasks
- Changing models during a project
- Provider-specific features

By selecting the right model for each task, you'll get better results and a more efficient workflow with AI-First TextEditor.
